entry.def: A helping of food is the amount of it that you get in a single serving.

example.ex: She gave them extra helpings of ice-cream.
example.tran: 她又给了他们几份冰激凌。

entry.tran: （尤指某种特性的）一些，一定量
entry.def: You can refer to an amount of something, especially a quality, as a helping of that thing.

example.ex: It took a generous helping of entrepreneurial confidence to persevere during this incident.
example.tran: 在这一事件中坚持下来是有了充足的创业信心的。

means.word_mean: 1. an individual quantity of food or drink taken as part of a meal;

Sentence.sentence: Helping their children to bring their talent into full play.

billion in American high schools, helping to open about 1,000 small schools-most of them with about 400 kids each with an average enrollment of only 150 per grade, About 500 more are on the drawing board.
Pat's children were with their father, so she took a picnic lunch to her friends new plays, then spend the day helping her unpack and get settled
Changes at the high-school level are also helping to make it easier for many students to earn their undergraduate degrees in less time.
Many developing countries have lots of young people in need of jobs; many rich countries need helping hands that will boost tax revenues and keep up economic growth.

sentences.en: The new charity tries to offer a helping hand to young people who have become addicted to drugs.
sentences.cn: 新成立的慈善机构试图帮助那些吸毒成瘾的年轻人。

sentences.en: A helping hand would be very welcome at the moment.
